intro: Navarretia latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its delicate, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open, sunny habitats. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, seed-like fruits called siliques. Navarretia latifolia is often found in coastal and inland areas, thriving in cool, moist environments.
